Reviews.Title: “Ok lockation near K´Dam”
Reviews.Author: folo18939
Reviews.Content: Located one block from K'Dam. Room small but newly renovated. Coffee and tea to boil. You can drink water from the tap. The room was too hot. Nice restaurants nearby. Around Savignyplatz are several restaurants. "Die Dicke Wirtin" is a traditional German restaurant. The breakfast is ok but nothing special. We found that it was not worth the tourist card to go and visit museums. Solve day tickets covering zooner you plan to go.

Reviews.Title: “Mark Apart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmericanGirl1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located about two blocks from the hotel which was very convenient. It's close to the Zoo and Aquarium. The breakfast was very good and included fresh coffee and a traditional style meat and cheese assortment along with fruit and yogurt. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The negatives were that the hallway we were in smelled like cigarette smoke as well as the room. We left the window open for most of the day while we were gone to bring in fresh air. The carpets were vaccuum cleaned but had stains and the sink in the bathroom leaked all over the floor. Overall the experience was average for the $$ that we spent.

Reviews.Title: “It's an apartment not an hotel”
Reviews.Author: mags2012
Reviews.Content: It was clean,warm close to main street. Long distance to airport. It does not have a bar or restaurant in it :( Beds are two singles pushed together.....instead of a double,we didnt say anything at the start as we pushed them together but they slip apart again! Staff were friendly and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Christmas Break”
Reviews.Author: Ian F
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the Christmas period. Perfect location for walking around the city or catching the U/S-bahns to travel further afield. Friendly and relaxed atmosphere and lots of cafes nearby for breakfast, lunch etc. The breakfast in the hotel is good value too if you are in a rush and dont want to go out. The front of the hotel is on a fairly busy street but our room looked out to the back and was silent at night. The only downside is that because the hotel offers both smoking and non-smoking rooms some of the public spaces (hall ways for example) do smell a little of cigarette smoke but our room itself was perfectly smoke free and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, helpful staff. Will definately stay here on my next stay to Berlin. Linda

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claire_Georgeson
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel – excellent rooms. Location is 10 min walk to the ‘main’ street, however there’s a train station nearby. Rooms were small and compact, but extremely clean and funky! Bathroom was fab. Highly recommend for the price (I paid under £100 for two nights over the weekend in Oct.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Zablar
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel near Kurfürstendamm. Just a few minutes walk to the U-Bahn station Uhlandstraße and Berlins biggest shopping street. The breakfast was delicious, the staff was friendly and the room was spacious and clean. The hotel has everything you need for a weekend getaway in Berlin. The Bus from Airport Tegel stops at the Uhlandstraße and it`s very easy to find the hotel from there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Nice, Modern”
Reviews.Author: lara s
Reviews.Content: Decent room size, small twin beds were side by side on a raised platform, but that was ok since I was traveling with my best friend. Super clean, nice, modern. Good location, safe, close to transportation, 15-20 min. train ride to nightlife, or close by has expensive restaurant/lounge options. WIFI 3 EUROS per hour, or 10 EUROS a day, annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for families.”
Reviews.Author: slim8589
Reviews.Content: The Good The rooms are very large which is ideal if, like us, you are a family with kids. There is a sofa bed that was made up for us every day. There is also a balcony and the room is plenty big enough with good storage for us all to feel quite comfortable. The staff were very friendly, spoke excellent English and were very helpful. The location is very good, 5 mins walk from the U-Bahn. There is a branch of Kaiser's (a supermarket) just around the corner. The price was very reasonable for a city hotel. The room was clean and made up every day. The Not So Good The hotel does feel and look a little tired (not a problem for us). The road outside is quite noisy and this might be an issue for some. There is no bar, just the breakfast room, so nowhere to sit in the evening if you want, again not a big issue as there are plenty of bars/cafes nearby. No air con in our room and it was pretty stuffy during our stay (28°C in August). The location although good in many ways is quite a long way from the airport and took us 2 hours using public transport (although a taxi back took 30 mins and cost €35). Overall we were very happy with our stay at this hotel and if we return to Berlin would choose it again as it suits us as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Non budget hotel ideal for travellers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: nystate0fmind
Reviews.Content: The reception staff at this hotel are all very friendly and speak very good English. The hotel is located on a road running parallel to the kurfurstendam and as such is very close to s-bahn stations, bus stops and all the major shops in west Berlin. At check in we were allocated a very large room on the ground floor which was very good value for the price we had paid. The room had a sofa, excellent air conditioning, bath/shower and was very clean, modern and stylish. A few minor points to note: tea and coffee making facilities were on the desk in the room but no tea or coffee was provided?! Bathrooms have a small pedal bin screwed to the wall right where most people would want to put their foot whilst sat on the toilet which was annoying. Internet is not free and is €3 per hour or €10 per day and must be purchased from reception, breakfast is €12.50 but we did not try that as there are many excellent cafes/restaurants in the local area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrscherry2000
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here for 5 nights during. The hotel looks run down from the outside, but is in better shape inside. The room we stayed in was spacious by European standards. No A/C but we found that even in July it wasn't necessary. Yes, if you are on the street side, the noise can keep you awake if your windows and balcony door are open but knowing this I brought earplugs and slept well. We only spent our evenings here and didn't eat in the hotel but breakfast smelled good in the morning. There's a grocery store around the corner as well as a wonderful bakery at the corner of Uhlandstrasse and Ku'damm. We picked up a sandwich every morning. Fridge is in the room so we used it for some cold drinks and snacks we got from Kaiser's. I could pick up Telkonet wi-fi from my balcony so I could use the 600 minutes I purchased from them for 20 Euros. The hotel wi-fi is pretty high. All in all the location of the hotel is ideal. It is close to the multitude of restaurants in the Ku'Damm vicinity as well as great shopping and access to the U-Bahn and S-Bahn. The Zoo Station will get you anywhere you need easily. Construction on the U-Bahn from Uhlandstrasse will only get you a few stops at this point.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Corvette8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my son and was very pleased. This is a nice hotel with good staff. The location is perfect, just off Kurfürstendamm. Big clean rooms, no aircon though. I liked it and found the rates very competitive. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: ricardogt
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I spent 3 nights in this Hotel. The room I got was "cosy" (not to mention really small) however, the room had everything that I expected. Before booking, I remember reading a review of somebody that was mentioning the need to crawl to go to bed. I thought it was a joke...but no! you can't go to sleep unless you crawl over the bed to reach the pillows cause the bed has walls on each sides and a window in the back! My room was always extremely hot (air con was off) to the point i had to open the windows at night to cool down the temperature. Outside was freezing so it was quick to cool it down. Charging 3€ per hour to have internet is completely out dated!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, generously sized rooms, decent location.”
Reviews.Author: HistTeacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as part of a trip to Europe over Christmas vacation. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport--simply take the X9/109 bus from the airport to Uhlandstrasse. When you get off the bus at Uhlandstrasse, walk down the Uhlandstrasse (on the same side of the road) and make a right onto Litzenburgerstrasse. The hotel will be on your right (there is a bear statue out front and the building is white with colorful balconies). The staff at the hotel is incredibly friendly and accommodating. We had lost our luggage and missed a night at the hotel due to snow and the hotel had printed out all of the messages that we sent them about our stay (and kept our room open for us) and they took down any notation necessary about our luggage. They also provided us with a toothbrush and toothpaste. They were willing and able to help in any way possible. The rooms at the hotel were roomy (by Europe standards), clean, well decorated and comfortable. The hotel is off of Kurfurstendammstrasse (the shopping center of what was West Berlin). It is a busy street with a lot of shops and places to eat. It is also close to the Uhlandstrasse U-bahn stop. (The stop is on the corner of Uhlandstrasse and Kurfurstendammstrasse.) I recommend taking the U-bahn whenever possible as the hotel is a long walk from many of the sights (like the Brandenburg Gate). My husband and I walked to the Brandenburg Gate, and while it is do-able, it took us over 2 hours (in very cold, snowy weather!), so we took the U-bahn back to our hotel--quick and easy to use! All-in-all, this is a great hotel for a visit to Berlin. It is a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovation, So Be Prepared..”
Reviews.Author: rugbyplaer
Reviews.Content: Friendly and Courteous staff, but be forewarned, this hotel is under renovation and on Nov. 26 and Nov 29, 2010, I was woken by construction work at 7 AM!! The Mark Apart hotel is a bit tired and showing its age. When you approach the hotel the first thing you notice is the lights in two of the letters in the hotels name are out(unless fixed). On checking-in on Wednesday Nov. 24, 2010, my original room, # 416, was so small, it was claustrophobic. Problems with the room included: a) carpeting was very badly stained, b)the lamp in the room was shorting and did not work so no main light in the room, c) broken furniture, d) extensive mold on the ceiling in the corners, a indication water leakage from outside. A bathroom so small you had to straddle the toilet, in order to close the bathroom door to enter the shower! In the middle of the night, I saw 2 roaches in the bathroom. After being up for almost 55 hours, I did not have the energy to complain. On Nov 25, 2010, I requested of the front desk to change my room because of the problems with the room( I also submitted to them a list of the problems). The front desk staff were very accommodating in switching my room, another room(#207). If you do not have a breakfast plan included in your trip, it is 12.50 Euro or about $17.50 US dollars if you choose to eat at the Marc Apart breakfast buffet. There are no breakfast places near the hotel, but 2 supermarkets around the block from the Mark Apart. As a previous guess to the Mark Berlin, I felt that the MarK Apart, would be slightly below the Mark Berlin, not in needing so much work. I was totally disappointed in the Mark Apart. It is sad that its owners allowed it to become so shabby and rundown before renovating it. I would be reluctant to stay in another Mark Hotel with such un-even standards. I submitted a request to Mark Hotels head office for a e-mail or regular mailing address to submit a formal letter of complaint. I have not heard back from them. I would assume that they are not interested in getting feedback from guest. Is it too much to ask for a decent hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “a nice and covenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albo64
Reviews.Content: It's clean, nice room and convenient to visit the town. I think is a perfect choice for a family due to the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Forget this hotel in summer”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation99
Reviews.Content: This hotel has no air conditioning and no fans. It is located on a busy street so that when you open the windows to get relief from the heat you are kept awake by the loud car and motorcycle noise.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very good”
Reviews.Author: gtbairns
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel I feared the worst as the building is a bit tired. That is the worst thing I have to say about this hotel. The bedrooms are massive, the hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly. Situated just around the corner of the Kurfürstendamm, the hotel is a 2 minute walk from Uhlandstrasse underground. Berlin Zoo is also close by as well as Kaiser Wilhelm Gedachtniskirche. Very very nice part of Berlin with easy access all over the city

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms, good value.”
Reviews.Author: TiberiusVerax
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about Mark Apartmenthotel as this was the cheapest I booked in our two month trip to Europe. I was pleasantly surprised. If you are looking for luxury, this is not the hotel for you. However, its location is excellent, a short walk to Kurfurstendamm, Uhlandstrasse U-bahn station, shops, restaurants, etc. Our room was large by European standards, it was clean as was the bathroom. I chose to find my own parking and found a parking lot further up the road at a reasonable daily rate. There is no need to have breakfast at the hotel. There are numerous cafes and bakeries which are cheaper and much more interesting. On the negative side, we arrived at 12:00 and were told that the rooms would not be ready before 14:00. We came back after lunch and a bit of sightseeing, and were told to take a seat in the waiting area. No one came to tell us that the room was ready until I finally asked. Internet is available but, at €3/hour or €10/day, is ridiculously expensive (I can't understand why some hotels still choose not to provide this service for free). The hotel should also provide a luggage drop off/pick up area so those with cars have an easier time rather than struggling for a parking space in the street. Finally, our balcony was quite dirty and it was obvious it hadn't been cleaned for quite a while.

Reviews.Title: “Not advisable”
Reviews.Author: JND1964
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11.45. We were told that the room will be ready at 15.00 (3pm). That's fine. We went for lunch and came back at 14.15. We were told to wait in the living room adjacent to the reception and we will be informed whether the room is ready or not. We kept waiting. Some guests arrived as from 14.30, their rooms were ready. At 15.00, I went to the receptionist and informed him whether the room would be ready, as we were supposed to be informed about it since 14.15. He told me to wait 5 - 10 more minutes. We we checked into the room. The balcony was filthy, cigarette butts, matches lying around and it seems to me that it hasn't been cleaned for weeks, if not months.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelboy71
Reviews.Content: stayed here during the week of 2 - 5th march 2010. good hotel, large rooms didnt try breakfast so dont know what the food was like but instead went to marche in the kudamm which is excellent all fresh food food and they do a breakfast buffett for 11.90 euro well worth it have as much as you can eat etc. hotel in a excellent location just round the corner from the kudamm, and easy to find from the metro station .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ray339
Reviews.Content: We had excellent time in tBerlin and the hotel. We were very impressed with staffing and most of them speak good English. Overall, the hotel is a very good value for money. Rooms are very clean, good size, and tidy. We were surprised that the room contains two single beds instead of double ones! I was under the impression that there are coffee and tea facilities but it was not available. So if you planning a long stay make sure that you have your own kettle. We have decided to move up and to the back of the hotel as it has been recommended by one of the reviewer before. It was not a problem for the hotel. Certain rooms have Wi-Fi points but it is not free and it costs 10EU per 24 hours to be activated for your use. There is a TV in the room but you will enjoy the Dutch channels with one exception (CNN news channel). I know many reviewers mentioned the breakfast but if you have used travel inn hotels before it is similar quality with slight difference. We had breakfast once in the hotel but we tried another place named “Marche” which offers a fantastic open Buffet with a similar price. The hotel is very central to the main shopping street and historic places and all within walking distance. Simply, you do not need a car. We have used taxi for and back of the airport and it did cost 30-35 pounds per trip. Several reviewers used the train from the zoo station and it is about 10-15 min walks from the hotel and trains run every half an hour. I hope you find my review helpful and certainly I would recommend the hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: yankees1984
Reviews.Content: This is a very decent hotel; my wife and I were surprised by how large the room is in comparison to other European hotels. The room was comfortable, the bathroom was adequate. The hotel was clean and the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast is also great and highly recommended. The only negative against this hotel is the road noise, you can hear the road noise if you have a room facing the front of the hotel. Another great plus for this hotel is the location; it is a 15 minute walk to the Church War memorial "Gedächtniskirche". The train station is also 5 minutes away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Clean Hotel, Would Return”
Reviews.Author: travelcat22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of July and found it to be good value for money. The hotel was clean and tidy and the room and bathroom spacious. We were allocated a room on the 5th floor towards the back of the hotel, which although we didn't have a balcony, was fine because we didn't get much traffic noise at night. Breakfast was nice, a little more choice than I've had at other european hotels I've stayed in, decent breakfast for a 3* hotel. Staff we founf to be very friendly and all spoke english. We arrived about midnight and were hungry, we found that a lot of resturaunts stay open well into the early hours of the morning serving hot food, so we found ourselves eating out at 1 in the moring. When you arrive at the airport take the S-Bahn to Zoo station, you buy you ticket at the station, but don't forget to validate it in the red boxes on the platform. I think it was only a couple of euros and the trip lasts around 40 mins. Once you arrive at zoo either take a taxi from outside the station to the hotel or it's about a 15 minute walk. We travelled in July and it was incredibly hot, so dont forget to take suncream and a hat if you travel in the summer months. We found walking aroung Berlin good for sightseeing, however we were knackered after the first day so opted for public transport after this. We bought a day pass for 6 euros each from the zoo station, you only validate it once but you can use the puiblic transport as much as you like. I dont know if you need a separate ticket for the S-Bahn and U-Bahn as we only used the S-Bahn. Alternatively you can buy a single ticket which I think is valid for two hours for about 2.60 euros. There is a U-Bahn stop relatively close to the hotel, called Ulandstrasse. As far as sightseeing goes there is an endless amout to see and do in Berlin, hense why we used the S-Bahn in the end so we could get to the sights faster in our short amount of time. I hope this review is helpful, please email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: MDMomTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenagers and I spent 4 nights at the Mark Apart in Berlin. I had selected this hotel based on reviews that I had read and I was not disappointed. We stayed in a family room, which was quite large by European standards. It had a large main room with 2 single beds, a large bathroom and a smaller room with a double bed. It also had lots of closet space. It was nice having space where we could spread out and relax after a long day of site seeing. The location was great - very close to the Ku'damm and public transportation. The price was amazing, especially for Berlin. The only bad thing about the bathroom is that the shower/tub did not have a shower curtain and the plexiglass divider between the tub and the rest of the bathroom did not run the full length of the tub. So the floor tended to get very wet after showers. But the maid service was good and the bathroom was always clean, which is my primary concern when it comes to hotel bathrooms. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as it wasn't included in our room price and it wasn't cheap. But I'm glad we didn't because there are many cafes nearby as well as a bakery and small grocery store. We had very inexpensive breakfasts by buying things at the grocery store and bakery and bringing them back to our room. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent/clean/spacious room”
Reviews.Author: MarouGreece
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and in a very logical price! We were lucky because we used an offer, staying for 3 nights but we only paid for the 2 nights!!! The location was perfect, only 5-10 minutes walk from the nearest metro station. And in the centre of the market in the "former West Berlin". The room was large even for 3 people!!! The breakfast was delicious and the service excellent. I fully recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “BERLIN IN MAY”
Reviews.Author: MARS07_9
Reviews.Content: Hotel location and accomodations were acceptable.Staff was accomodating as well. BE SURE NOT TO LEAVE VALUABLES IN THE ROOM! My wife had here jewelry stolen from the room. When she went to report it at the receptionist desk, there was another guest at the front counter reporting his camera stolen from his room. I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: viking0
Reviews.Content: We just spend four nights at this good clean german hotel - well located and nice big rooms - a bit run down when youl look into the corners - (But who goes to berlin to look into corners ) but altogether and okay deal still. The fact that you get a big room - a big bathroom - and that everything is clean and that the beds is good is all + for the hotel. The minus things are - 1. The breakfast is a bit to expensive - 12 euro for a standard breakfast. 2. The hotel could use and information board - there where lines of guest waiting for informations. The staff did not impres me - the receptionist was irrertated because i wanted to book one more period later this summer. But when that is said is a nice hotel deal for a trip to berlin - try walking 5 min over to Kantstrasse and sit at the Savigny platz - plenty of nice restaurent and there`s a french paris like atmosphere.. good prices. Try evt schwarze cafe good alternative place open 24 hours. will return again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexYorkie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a nice short break in Berlin. Two mature couples - booked with Ryanair/Expedia and got a very good deal. The hotel room was extremely clean and comfortable. The beds were comfortable too - we asked for extra pillows which we got. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The saftey deposit box is free. You can hire an umberella no charge just a deposit. You do need to get transport for the sights but it is very cheap. We got a BVD ticket at the airport - 24.50 euros each - this was for three days and took us on all the trains, buses, trams and ferries. The transport system is excellent - never a wait and almost always a seat. Must mention a fantastic resturant Stella di Mare. We went there on another person review. It is a lovely place with an extensive menu. Good quality food at very reasonable prices. I am a fussy veggie and I was not disappointed. Kostas the waiter is very friendly. We told him we would be back the next night and he had reserved a table for us.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ELLIE13
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant short break in Berlin - good location, large clean quiet room, helpful reception staff, who told us which buses we needed to get to places of interest and the longest breakfast period, that I've ever come across (6am - 12.00), always pleanty of fresh food, cheese, meat etc.whatever time we chose to eat -well done to the Mark Apart Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: sootyScotland
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 4 nights, we found it very central for the underground which we used to get around the city it was very easy to use. We also used the hop on hop off bus to see the sights which has earphones in 6 different languages to tell you all about the sights you are passing, this was located 5 minute walk from the hotel. There is plenty of shops and various places to eat close at hand, the food here is really good and I must give the restaurant Stella di Mare a special mention and to Kostas the man that looked after us on our visits there, was extremely good and very friendly and went out of his way to make sure we enjoyed our dinner. When you go out of the hotel turn left, down to the next crossroads turn right and its on the left, 2 minute walk. The hotel from the outside does not look very good, but once inside , the bedrooms are very spacious and clean the bathroom is lovely and also clean, it has a balcony, a mini bar, tv but no kettle for your tea(we missed this) and no aircon which was really hot at night we had the balcony door open but was quite noisy. Breakfast was served up to 12.00 it had a good enough range of continental breakfast and had eggs scrambled and boiled along with bacon which was plenty to keep you going , we found it was very busy between 8.00 and 9.00. It was a very enjoyable stay. When we arrived at Shoenfeld airport we took the train to Kurfensdam station which took about the hour and cost 2.80 euros with one change at zoo. We took a taxi on our way back and it cost about 35 euros and it only took about 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bomberastle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mark Apart for 5 nights at the end of July 2008. The hotel is well situated and easy to find. It is very clean and has polite and attentive staff. The breakfast, which was included, was a positive and set you up well for the day ahead. We had a street facing room and with temperatures averaging 35C, we had to have the windows open because of a lack of air conditioning - I am sure that in "normal" weather conditions that this would not have been a problem but there was a fair amount of street noise penetration. Advice - ask to be located at the rear of the hotel! That aside - we award full marks and the hotel proved excellent value for money. Clive, Angela and Stuart - Halesowen, England.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value/location”
Reviews.Author: ponchik
Reviews.Content: Travelling by car to Russia, my wife an me were staying in this hotel for a short stopover combined with a short sightseeing trip through the city. Nice coincidence: It was the night of the Eurocup soccer final and the city center was in action. The location is very good as it is only a few footsteps away from the Kurfürstendamm, the former city-center of West-Berlin. Here you find all kinds of public transportation facilities (metro, buses). The new Berlin central railway station is however on a considerable distance (approx. 3 km). The breakfast buffet was standard, but ok. There was all we needed. Car parking lot is safely situated in the inner yard of the hotel. The hotel room was clean and large and the equipment was standard. The reception staff was friendly and supplied us with all the requested information. We booked online and got the room for only 65 Euro (weekend-tariff). If your aim is sightseeing in Berlin at a lower budget, we can highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: proceed_to_departure
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in June 08. Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Zoo station. From the outside it doesnt look like the best hotel but inside the rooms are LOVELY! I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Room was huge and even had a mini-bar which was a surpirse! It would have easily slept another 2 people even though it was only a double room. Huge wardrobes and plenty of space for all our things. Breakfast is served from 7-12pm. Its served on the first floor in the breakfast room. It wasnt the best, but was enough to keep you going for a few hours. Most of the choice was meats such as ham, pork and lots of cheese! Also available is rolls and cerals. They didnt have much 'hot' food which was a little dissapointing. Its great place to stay if you are planning to visit Berlin. To get the the main sights such as Brandonburg Gate etc we just took the metro from Kurfürstendamm, which is the main shopping street in Berlin and is only located a short 5 min walk away from the hotel. We didnt have any problems which this hotel and we very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rusc
Reviews.Content: My mum, sister and I stayed here for 3 nights 10-13 Jan, '08 and were very pleased. Our room was huge. We gave the double room to my mum (who was celebrating her 65th Birthday) and my sister and I shared the twin area which was larger than the normal hotel room. The bathroom was also big. What pleased by sister also was the balcony. It meant she did not have to travel down and stand outside the hotel every night to have her last ciggarette before bed! The central location meant we were walking distance from everywhere. Kurfustendam was just around the corner. We even walked home from the Berlin Wall following the hotel map. I nearly forgot to mention the real plus for me. Breakfast was served until 12pm. Unheard of!! It meant we did not have to set our alarms which was nice. Staff, food, cleanliness all excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: perli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed in one of the family rooms for two nights with three children, 8, 11, and 14. On the plus side, we had plenty of space and the linens seemed fresh and clean. Little bags of chocolate all over the room were a delight for the kids. The bathroom was clean and there were plenty of towels. The buffet breakfast had something for everyone. The price for two nights was only 209 euro (about $160), which is really cheap for central Berlin. On the downside, the hotel needs renovating. The carpeting is dingy and old and the room was kind of depressing overall. When I went to use the plastic soap dispenser in the shower, it fell off the wall. The liquid soap is of poor quality (bring your own), and when we ran out of Kleenex, we were only given a few more the next day! It was a bit noisy at night, but I always bring earplugs! If you aren't fussy and you're on a budget, the hotel is adequate and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and exceptionally high standard!”
Reviews.Author: M_and_SHerts_England
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via "Lastminute.com" and chose the hotel because of excellent reviews on this site. The hotel doesn't look up to much from the outside (a bit 80's peach colour!) but the location is excellent and the quality of service, cleanliness, standard of room, size of room and quality of breakfast was excellent. For a 3 star hotel as a base for exploring Berlin, you couldn't beat this hotel. 2 minutes walk from the bus stop on the Ku'damm which brings you straight from Tegel, which is also next to the Uhlandstrasse U-Bahn. Plenty of shopping, bars and restaurants within a few minutes walk. Quiet area, very accessible. Popular with businessmen, which makes it quiet in the evening and less of a creche at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: adv_for_travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location near the shopping district. The double room was large, clean, and has comfortable beds. As a previous reviewer stated there is no A\C but it wasn't an issue in October. The breakfast buffet was the best I had on the whole trip and the one girl maintaining it was always busy bringing more of anything that was low. The U1 subway stop Uhlandstrasse is about a 5 minute walk. There are two grocery stores and numerous restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel geat city”
Reviews.Author: duffy65
Reviews.Content: the hotel is is nothing to look at on the outside but inside you have very friendly staff Big rooms plenty of storage space and a balcony in most if not all cases breakfast is plentiful with sausage ,bacon and egg included, but it seems very busy up until 10am it seemed just one girl was trying to cater for everyone so that would be my only small gripe about the hotel we arrived at shoneifeld airport got the S9 train to savingyplatz which is one stop after the zoo it takes one hour and costs 2.10 euro to walk to the hotel is about ten minutes get your ticket at the machine which covers zones A B and validate it on the platform enjoy

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for the location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneEJ
Reviews.Content: If you've been travelling for a while and squeezing into compact rooms, this hotel is a welcome change. The rooms are pleasant and very large, but not air-conditioned, so with days at 30+degrees, we were lucky to be away from the west side of the building, so the heat wasn't too much of a problem and the room seemed to cool down well at night. The bathroom was of a high standard. Breakfast could get a bit frantic (as in crowded) but service was very good. The location is fantastic, and we particularly liked wandering into the leafy residential area south of Lietzenburger Str where there are some very nice restaurants. Lots of transport options were within easy walking distance and Tegel airport was a short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Malyboo
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel when arriving were not great, however we were pleasantly surprised and all of our party (14 adults) gave this hotel the thumbs up! Although it had no bar, its location was excellent and there were plenty of drinking and meeting places close by. The breakfast staff were good, reception helpful and the rooms were clean. In all the hotel was very good value for money and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: go4broke
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews prior to booking a room for the week May 6- May 16 from a bookings website. I was fairly confident I would be pleased, but everything exceeded my expectations. First, the location is very convenient to the Underground, and the Zoo Garden train station is within walking distance. I saw many of the hotels that get highly rated on TA in the area, so it is very nice area. The room size was enormous to me compared to other European or German hotel rooms. There was a couch, desk, nightstands with drawers on bothe sides of the bed, and an extra desk chair. The closet was an armoire with 2 sides for hanging clothes, and the middle portion had shelves. The bathroom was bright, clean, and had a nice shelf to put tolietries on. However, bring your own toiletries as the only thing provided is liquid soap and shower caps. A hairdryer was also in the room, and a magifying mirror. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of items including various rolls and breads, pastries, cereals, granola, scrambled eggs, bacon, soft boiled eggs, sausage, yogurts, fruits, apple and orange juice, coffee and water. It was wonderful. Got a great internet special as I prepaid with my CC--if you see a good deal here, I would jump on it

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunny19
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was one of the few that offered inclusive breakfast. Slightly annoyingly, the already competitive prices were even lower if we had booked at the last minute. We arrived rather late in the evening and were welcomed like old friends. All staff encountered were friendly and helpful. From the outside, the hotel is not the most attractive, but it really doesn't matter. The room pictured on this site was almost identical to ours - huge, comfortable and well-furnished. The bathroom was also spotless and modern. Rooms at the front are somewhat affected by traffic noise, more in the morning than evening, but otherwise the hotel is quiet. The excellent breakfast is served between 6.00 and 12.00 and is replenished, so there is always a good choice, including cooked items. Ask if you want tea rather than coffee. The area is near the Ku'Damm and it's best to use the Uhlandstraße underground, though if you want an direct journey from Schönefeld without changing trains, take the S9 to Savignyplatz, which is a longer walk. Make sure you leave at the Savignyplatz side of the station. The restaurant /bar next door served us food at almost midnight and we didn't feel rushed. When we left the hotel, we were able to leave bags and there is a guest-toilet with space to get organised before departure if your flight is later in the day. The only downside to this hotel is the overt porn that appears before the pay TV sign, so if you're channel-hopping, it's there. This is a shame, because there's nothing else slightly seedy about the hotel or the area, but families need to be aware of this before the TV is used! Overall, this is an ideal tourist hotel in an area that feels safe.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: smilern.ireland
Reviews.Content: stay here for 3 nights in april great hotel large room clean and great breakfast , would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: crushdummy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the MA for a week in early October. It is in a good location - a block off the Ku’damm, near a 109 airport bus stop, a U bahn station and the Zoo S bahn station. My first impression of the hotel was not favorable. Although the surrounding area is OK, the entrance to the MA is overgrown with weeds with a closed restaurant next door. However, inside it is clean and well cared for. Rooms are very large with clean, modern furniture. The rooms at the rear overlook a couple of courtyards and are very quiet. The large windows make them feel airy. The breakfast room is a little small but the quality and variety of the food is very good. The breakfast room staff was friendly and efficient. The front desk personnel were helpful. Overall, this hotel was a good value for the cost and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money at the Mark Apart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrewEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three nights and found the hotel to be excellent. It is clean, very well situated off Ku'damm and superb value for money. The breakfast is an all-you-can-eat buffet and is included in the room price. The only downside was that the room doesn't contain a safe but safety deposit boxes are available free of charge at reception and without any hesitation. Reception is open 24 hours. All TV channels are German with the exception of CNN, with the usual array of pay to view sports and movie channels available. A large bottle of water, a bottle of beer and two soft drinks are also provided free of charge. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again. The breakfast room had business travellers, familes with young children and adult groups so I guess it's suitable for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “we made a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mark Apart was in an excellent location.Lovely bedroom-large light and airy.Wonderful comfy beds-wish I could have brought one home with me! Excellent breakfast-lots of choice.Friendly staff,all of whom could speak some English. No bar in hotel but excellent one right next door. Only a few minutes from the main shopping area.Recommend the Maredo restaurant for mouth-watering steaks and brilliant service. Couldn't fault our stay. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't believe wrong bookings occurred in Germany!”
Reviews.Author: cinia
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thru' expedia. On arrival, street seemed a bit run-down. Were flabbergasted when told by the receptionist that they had erroneously booked us at their main hotel, the Berlin Mark Hotel on Meinecke strasse. Had to trundle luggage for 300 metres to our new accommodation, which hotel turned out to be good and inexpensive. But for that hotel see reviews under that name.

Reviews.Title: “What a friendly, reasonably priced hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ostrich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2003 on our first trip to Berlin. The staff at the hotel were brilliant, very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Rooms were quite ordinary but spacious and very clean with an excellent bathroom. Breakfast was nothing special but adequate and served by very friendly staff. This hotel is a good reasonably priced choice very near to the main shopping street, buses and underground. It is a little away from the main sights as these were mostly around the Reichstadt but we didn't mind walking and the buses were very punctual when our legs got tired. Hotel sells bus tickets and has a very useful street map of Berlin - staff very willing to help and advise.

HotelInfo.Name: Mark Apart Hotel Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Lietzenburger Strasse 82-84, 10719 Berlin, Germany
